definitions.definition: a vessel larger than a boat for transporting people or goods by sea.
examples: boat, vessel, craft they traveled by ship

definitions.definition: a sailing vessel with a bowsprit and three or more square-rigged masts.
any boat, especially a racing boat.
a spaceship.
an aircraft.
transport (goods or people) on a ship.
examples: the wounded soldiers were shipped home

definitions.definition: send by some other means of transport or by mail.
examples: the freight would be shipped by rail

definitions.definition: (of a product) be made available for purchase.
examples: the cellular phone is expected to ship at about $500 sometime this summer

definitions.definition: (of a naval force) go to sea from a home port.
examples: Bob got sick a week before we shipped out

definitions.definition: embark on a ship.
examples: people wishing to get from London to New York ship at Liverpool

definitions.definition: (of a sailor) serve on a ship.
examples: Jack, you shipped with the Admiral once, didn't you?

definitions.definition: (of a boat) take in (water) over the side.
take (oars) from the oarlocks and lay them inside a boat.
fix (something such as a rudder or mast) in its place on a ship.
a romantic pairing between two characters in a fictional series, often one that is supported or portrayed by fans rather than depicted in the series itself.
examples: the thing that I loved about the Mulder/Scully ship was that we knew so much about their characters

definitions.definition: support or have a particular interest in a romantic pairing between two characters in a fictional series, often when this relationship is one portrayed by fans rather than depicted in the series itself.
forming nouns:
denoting a quality or condition.
denoting status, office, or honor.
denoting a tenure of office.
denoting a skill in a certain capacity.
denoting the collective individuals of a group.
